an7.31:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these seven downfalls for a lay follower …
an7.31:4.2: There are these seven successes for a lay follower.
an7.31:4.4: They don’t stop seeing the mendicants. They don’t neglect listening to the true teaching. They train in higher ethical conduct. They’re very confident about mendicants, whether senior, junior, or middle. They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind. They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for teachers worthy of offerings. And they serve the Buddhist community first.
an7.31:4.5: These are the seven successes for a lay follower.”
an7.31:8.3: A lay follower who practices these
an7.31:8.4: falls away from the true teaching.
an7.31:9.1: A lay follower doesn’t stop seeing
an7.31:12.3: A lay follower who practices these
an7.31:12.4: doesn’t fall away from the true teaching.”
